TITLE:  Director of Data AnalyticsTYPE:  Direct HireLOCATION:  100% Remote - Headquarters located in Cherry Hill, NJONSITE/REMOTE/HYBRID:  100% RemoteSTART DATE:  March 2023SHIFT:  M-F, 830-5pm ESTVACCINATION REQUIREMENT:  NoneWe are looking for a Director of Data Analytics to manage the enterprise—wide data & analytics processes and provide the company with useful insight for decisions in these areas.  You will collaborate with C-level executives and key stakeholders to develop and improve data models that align with the organization’s mission and values.  We are in the healthcare industry and the ideal candidate has performed a similar role utilizing healthcare data.MAIN RESPONSIBILITIESLead efforts organization-wide to turn data into information and then provide insights to upper management based on your findingsLead a team to understand what information needs are required by the business, then create customized reports based on what the business is looking forEvaluate, organize, and improve the enterprise-wide data reporting models Drive to improve the efficiency of analytics practices at the company by working with the analytics and development teams to understand how data is measured and usedLayout and engage in best data practices and direct teams to use these solutions in order to optimize reporting on findingsProficiency using machine learning and artificial intelligence models along with standardized reports and dashboardsLead the data analytics team in developing meaningful solutions trough innovation, evaluation, review and development Provide insights into the information that you are creating to help drive business decisionsDrive data governance best practices in order to ensure that the data you are refining into information is relevant and as accurate as possible QUALIFICATIONS A Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science or a related field is required.  Master’s degree is preferred10+ years in a Business Intelligence role with at least 5 years of team management experienceExperience working with data in the healthcare or insurance industriesExcellent presentation and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex concepts to executives and non—technical stakeholdersExpert—level decision making when choosing modeling, analyzing and reporting techniques and best practicesAbility to work with a variety of data visualization tools and to choose the best tool for the jobUnderstanding of data warehousing and how data is stored and is moved within a database is a big plus but not requiredHands-on experience with analytics techniques not limited to regression, decision trees, clustering and multi-variate analysis EOE STATEMENTWe are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law.
